question: What is the Nexus course?
answer: Nexus is a paid, live, in-depth web development, blockchain development and HLD System Design course designed by Rohit. and also you will get the DSA in C++ paid course free with Nexus course. and the DSA course is not live you will get the recording of DSA course.

question: Is the Nexus course free or paid?
answer: It is a paid course. Regular price is ₹6000, but a limited-time offer is available for ₹4000.

question: How much does the Nexus course cost and when does the offer end?
answer: The course costs ₹6000, but there's an early bird offer of ₹4000 which ends tonight at 12:00 AM.

question: Is the Nexus course live or recorded?
answer: The course will be live to ensure real-time interaction and error-solving with students.

question: How is the Nexus course different from Udemy courses?
answer: Nexus offers deeper, hands-on, live learning including internal workings and real-world project applications. Udemy is more generic.

question: What is covered in the course content?
answer: Web Development (HTML, CSS, JS, React, Node.js, MongoDB, APIs), Blockchain (Ethereum, Solana, Smart Contracts), Real-world projects.

question: What is the validity of the Nexus course?
answer: The course is valid for 3 years.

question: How can I enroll in the Nexus course?
answer: You can enroll via the website or Coder Army app. A direct link is provided in the video description.

question: When does the Nexus course start and what are the class timings?
answer: The course starts from 16th September, 2024. Classes are from 9 PM to 10 PM, Monday to Friday.

question: Is the Nexus course suitable for complete beginners in coding?
answer: Yes, it's beginner-friendly and starts from internet basics before diving into programming.

question: Who should not take this course?
answer: Students preparing for GATE, those who already have a web dev course, or those unfamiliar with Rohit's teaching style.

question: Will I get a certificate after completing the course?
answer: Yes, a certificate will be provided, but the main focus is on gaining real knowledge.

question: Can I watch the course on my phone or laptop?
answer: Yes, the course can be accessed via both mobile (Coder Army app) and laptop through the website.

question: Why is the course not available for iOS users?
answer: Because iOS takes a 30% cut on in-app purchases, so the course is only available on Android and web.

question: What kind of projects are included in the course?
answer: Real-world freelance projects used by the instructor, focused on earning and hands-on learning.

question: Who will resolve my doubts and coding errors?
answer: There will be dedicated Teaching Assistants (TAs) to help resolve doubts during and after live classes.

question: Will MERN stack and Blockchain be launched separately?
answer: No, both are integrated into one course to provide continuous and cohesive learning.

question: Is EMI available for students?
answer: Yes, EMI options are available during payment.

question: What about international students facing payment issues?
answer: Students from Pakistan and Bangladesh are facing temporary issues. A solution is being worked on.

question: Is anything free for Coder Army students?
answer: Yes, some dynamic programming, trie, and segment tree series are available for free via the Coder Army app.
